reasoning: The transcription provides a step-by-step process of cooking chicken thighs with a side of spinach. The steps are extracted based on the actions described by Jacques Pepin, starting from preparing the chicken thighs to cooking them and preparing the spinach garnish.
dish_description: The dish is a simple yet flavorful meal consisting of sauted chicken thighs with crispy skin, served with a side of steamed garlic spinach.

cooking_steps.description: Prepare the chicken thighs by placing them skin side down and cutting around the bone to expose it, which aids in cooking.
Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper on both sides.
Start cooking the chicken thighs skin side down in a nonstick skillet without any added fat, as the skin will release enough fat for cooking.
Brown the chicken thighs for 2 to 3 minutes on high heat, then cover with a lid and cook for about 20 minutes on low heat without turning them.
While the chicken cooks, prepare the garlic by crushing it to remove the skin.
After the chicken has cooked for 20 minutes and is tender and browned, remove it from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet with the chicken drippings, add the crushed garlic and shake the skillet to mix, then add the baby spinach.
Add a couple of tablespoons of water to the skillet to start the steaming process for the spinach, cover it, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and cook for another minute.
